alert.note: Alert for Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 2:25AM EDT until April 09 at 12:48PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following county...Warren. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain occurred due to thunderstorms Thursday evening. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell. - For Paulins Kill at Blairstown: At 2:15am the stage was 5.87 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 10. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
